name: millimolar
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
measured in, or relating to, millimoles (= one thousandth of a mole): Millimolar concentrations of lithium ion are needed to have this action. Blood and tissue levels of vitamin C will remain high, with millimolar levels close to those of blood sugar.
More examplesFewer examplesMillimolar increases in extracellular K+ concentration powerfully enhance epileptiform activity in the hippocampus.Hydrogen is observed at up to millimolar concentrations in fluids from focused hydrothermal venting sites at mid-ocean ridges.

a unit of measurement of the amount of a substance in a liquid : A millimolar is the decimal fraction of a molar, which is the common non-SI unit of molar concentration. The internal potassium in animal cells is of the order of a hundred and fifty millimolar.
More examplesFewer examplesTen millimolar AG was supplemented to the maturation medium.Try to express final concentrations in molar/millimolar/micromolar units where possible.One millimolar extracellular Ca 2+ is sufficient and necessary for egg activation.
